questions.question: What is the primary benefit of creating a Grocery List before going shopping?
options: To avoid impulse buying and ensure you don't forget essential items
questions.explanation: A grocery list acts as a memory aid and a budgeting tool, preventing unnecessary purchases and ensuring you get what you need.

questions.question: Which Excel feature allows you to create a dropdown menu (e.g., selecting 'Cardio' or 'Strength') in an Exercise Planner?
questions.explanation: Data Validation with the 'List' option creates a dropdown menu, ensuring consistency in how exercises are recorded.

questions.question: In an Exercise Planner, what does the column 'Reps' (Repetitions) typically stand for?
options: The number of times you go to the gym
The number of times a specific movement is performed in a single set
questions.explanation: Reps (Repetitions) refer to the number of times you complete a single exercise movement consecutively.

questions.question: To calculate the 'Total Estimated Cost' of your grocery list in Excel, which function should you use?
questions.explanation: The SUM function adds up all the values in the selected range, giving you the total cost.

questions.question: Which AI-powered app is commonly used for tracking diet, calories, and workouts?
questions.explanation: HealthifyMe and similar apps use AI to track nutrition and suggest fitness plans.

questions.question: If you want to sort your Grocery List so all 'Dairy' items appear together, which tool should you use?
questions.explanation: Sorting by the 'Category' column groups similar items together, making shopping more efficient in the store.

questions.question: Which formatting tool helps create a visual 'checkbox' effect (empty square) next to items in your list?
questions.explanation: Applying a border to a small, empty column next to your list items creates a box that looks like a checkbox for printing.

questions.question: Why is it useful to track 'Duration' in an exercise planner?
options: To monitor how much time is spent on specific activities for progress tracking
To see if the gym is open
questions.explanation: Tracking duration helps measure endurance and ensures you are meeting time-based fitness goals.

questions.question: What is the advantage of maintaining a 'Digital' grocery list (on a phone/cloud) over a paper one?
options: It can be shared with family members in real-time and edited anywhere
questions.explanation: Digital lists synced to the cloud allow multiple family members to add items and view the list while at the store.

questions.question: To quickly apply a professional look (colors and stripes) to your Exercise Planner, you can format your data range as a:
questions.explanation: Formatting as a Table (Ctrl+T) automatically applies banded rows, filter buttons, and a color scheme.

questions.question: Which column would NOT typically be in a Grocery List?
questions.explanation: Date of Birth is irrelevant for a shopping list.

questions.question: In Excel, if you want to visually highlight items that are 'High Priority', what feature can automatically turn the cell red?
questions.explanation: Conditional Formatting changes the cell color based on the cell's value (e.g., If cell contains 'Urgent', make it Red).

questions.question: When printing your grocery list, if the columns are too wide to fit on one page, you should adjust:
questions.explanation: Adjusting column widths or using the 'Fit to 1 Page Wide' setting ensures the entire list prints on a single sheet.

questions.question: How can you quickly check off items on a digital Excel list on your mobile?
options: Use a physical eraser on the screen
Use a Checkbox form control or change the cell color
questions.explanation: Interactive checkboxes or simply using the 'fill color' tool are common ways to mark items as done digitally.

questions.question: What does the 'Sets' column in an exercise planner represent?
options: The number of gym clothes you own
A group of repetitions performed without rest
questions.explanation: A 'Set' is a collection of reps. For example, 3 sets of 10 pushups means you do 10 pushups, rest, and repeat that 3 times.

questions.question: What does the small arrow in the header of an Excel Table allow you to do?
questions.explanation: The filter dropdown arrows allow users to sort data (A-Z) or filter out specific rows.

questions.question: To determine which grocery item costs the most, you could use the ______ function.
questions.explanation: The MAX function returns the largest number in a range.

questions.question: Which view in Excel is best for checking how your planner will look on paper before printing?
questions.explanation: Page Layout View shows headers, footers, and margins, giving a true representation of the printout.

questions.question: If you want to freeze the top row (headers) of your list so they don't disappear when you scroll down, use:
questions.explanation: Freeze Panes locks the top row in place for easy viewing of headers in long lists.

questions.question: Which of these is a benefit of tracking your exercise progress over time?
options: It uses up memory on the computer
It allows you to identify trends, improvements, and consistency
questions.explanation: Tracking data reveals progress patterns, helping to maintain motivation and adjust routines.
